title: English Language Arts: Grade 5
subject: English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

66BA88227ACD4FE3A2D1373D72CC1692.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and
phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however,
although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

4B626E3377074D32AB18C391B945FABE.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to
better understand each of the words.

B37207C5866240A897393CF528471944.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

C4F1CBB81C344D52A392B36F305432B9.description:
Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture), in
context.

94C07ED3126A45E8BAC522540EB69618.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

5CC490D8DF5D46138A0B7C4C53160D65.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses) to find the pronunciation
and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

CE9F994726EE4A669C8BEC147E7AD1D5.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a
word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

83A832B5A8BB4729B691759AE809B15A.description:
Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning
of a word or phrase.

194443D0CDE1417D9C1954993E7E55DE.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade
5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

90A7A9BFAC074A8196FFC8A1DDB69164.description: Compare and contrast the varieties of English (e.g., dialects, registers) used in literature.

BEFED27A43174280A87CD67FE5EF34AB.description: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

FB0719F7A07A40959487120BED3F2028.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

BBFE85A1607D4DB4AB02E8FB4549635E.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

5302F84714234D3089F7C2C81B0C5BE4.description: Use underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works.

6ADD1DD19DD944F48A62CA14E222D337.description:
Use a comma to set off the words yes and no (e.g., Yes, thank you), to set off a tag question
from the rest of the sentence (e.g., It’s true, isn’t it?), and to indicate direct address (e.g., Is that
you, Steve?).

38B0CC40E9184A2E8A4ACABD98F7E406.description: Use a comma to separate an introductory element from the rest of the sentence.

748308445CEA4F1787645D5AEBAC794A.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.

B0F9884E5FCC47FCB41296789042DFC5.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling
when writing.

4B999838C9BB40888ABBFEA706D76B0F.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense.

D2F1329395AE45ACB4219A10D01A1630.description: Use verb tense to convey various times, sequences, states, and conditions.

C847F45426604D579DE3F106F19200D0.description: Form and use the perfect (e.g., I had walked; I have walked; I will have walked) verb tenses.

4D973F93E24B427E9AEE32F478EEC271.description:
Explain the function of conjunctions, prepositions, and interjections in general and their function
in particular sentences.

55B342C85947416AB00B614DABFB7863.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

95A4AE1FD5F5409B8FD6A2DD528B31E8.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, using formal English when appropriate to task and
situation, such as when performing dramatic readings or presentations; use appropriate eye contact,
adequate volume, and clear pronunciation. (See grade 5 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific
expectations)

46DA8CF1DB9C4A7C8319F204A565809F.description:
Include multimedia components (e.g., graphics, sound) and visual displays in presentations when
appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

32D8B907CA264F40841CF39D60A123FF.description:
Report on a topic or text, or present an opinion, sequencing ideas logically and using appropriate facts
and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes or central ideas; speak clearly at an
understandable pace.

76BA9E82FC61410BABA16E4F9F7AF193.description:
Summarize the points a speaker makes and explain how each claim is supported by reasons and
evidence.

3E689A5A37894A4AB0714BABD9905BAD.description:
Summarize a written text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including
visually, quantitatively, and orally.

5F68F9C634924439ABE3E52D1E601B83.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and draw conclusions in light of information and knowledge
gained from the discussions.

C864BE6CFD77436AAD29FDC358AE33A5.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions by making comments that contribute to the discussion
and elaborate on the remarks of others.

A58A579D83164557BB9FFD7940A9C022.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

18998FBCE71B440F9C0E02548F61B4B2.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that
preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

3217712890CC4399B1BEC140CE8F1D67.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with
diverse partners on grade 5 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

F6E770D2E562458C8318EB0C18BD7460.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time
frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and
audiences.

4425429768D049F0A452106D15AE08EB.description:
Apply grade 5 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses
reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and
evidence support which point(s)”).

DE75A3C6E7764380A39250835782CA61.description:
Apply grade 5 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast stories in the same
genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and
topics”).

0922BEE421EE477FB1FA79B0B0600D49.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

9EA1C9B54C9A4878984903F5F0CECBA2.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital
sources; summarize or paraphrase information in notes and finished work, and provide a list of sources.

D1628694CD1544D294F2DDDF22850C24.description:
Conduct short research projects that use several sources to build knowledge through investigation of
different aspects of a topic.

6C7F3483C726473C8922CC1178BB092D.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

176D0BCA94E447AEB2A9BBCF8044EADD.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing as well as
to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills.

1AF0FBA8482E4D92926957ABEE299660.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by
planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should
demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 5.)

44DC19D2C5DF4284931AF14BF38C1B0C.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task,
purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3
above.)

4CF206DF7CDF42A1BAB8B5E996B3C658.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

9441B525BB124E29B8409B9F48654C9D.description: Use precise words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events.

6DAA9E70BD564860B6B91E2B3AA78B55.description: Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events.

87C08AA8822843DD830E4A22F0BA8433.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences
and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

88CF9A07C5DE417899FF0D93D4EFA6F9.description:
Use an organizational structure to orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a
narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

20EF86107FD346F9BB06BB4213C71540.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique,
descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

7F79F3503AE946D19864F68AE0CD43BD.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

669B09026D42498AAE103B80A9031325.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

424CF1B7E9734C7B9950A5868EC9729E.description:
Link ideas within and across categories of information using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g.,
in contrast, especially).

EACE6EFF91A24B95BC4E2BA317DE930B.description:
Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and
examples related to the topic.

A9F92E86CA504EE9A98577001D09DA97.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

DB9CE2DF3B8D4B21BB82E19F03C529BD.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

FA8C8E023B734E598C15B4DE23AAEB8C.description: Link opinion and reasons using words, phrases, and clauses (e.g., consequently, specifically).

D031A38F73704596AC5292B9326F4CC7.description: Provide logically ordered reasons that are supported by facts and details.

98C72E8C8F7F49E0B83B0CE1AFFE009F.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which
ideas are logically grouped to support the writer’s purpose.

4B8A823B19CE4DB39B730CC083F7C27A.description: Write opinion pieces that explain a perspective or point of view with supporting reasons and evidence.

610CF1BAB59D4F379D329C92D76AF3D2.description: Apply previous handwriting skills with accuracy and automaticity.

CB20FB91D5E84A9F85F6B13E40B8D6CE.description: Write legibly for a variety of tasks and purposes.

D9ED3E8B22754FE38A68A9B8E84899AA.description:
Orally read grade-level texts (e.g., poetry and prose) with accuracy, automaticity, and expression at an
appropriate rate to support comprehension, self-correcting as necessary.

546F9EC99C0448AC849AACC95DE086EB.description:
Accurately read unfamiliar multisyllabic words in and out of context using combined knowledge
of all sound-spelling correspondences, syllabication patterns and morphology (e.g., roots and
affixes).

BDC59A2001B14C0C8F2AE7564026CC2A.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to support decoding and encoding words.

895BDC4132ED4403B88DEB43AB1EAA40.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

4BE42DF7935248A1A61700D5431B1C12.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies,
science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 4–5 text complexity band independently and
proficiently.

710E0B0C146E40A0815F059776E11C2D.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E7BD7AFD9FCB4117B0C4E7A8E5C197CA.description:
Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject
knowledgeably.

7BAC69E2C1134BFBBC02EC13BB1DC6DB.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying
which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

5007ACE8E7D54BFB8981B91F5E6A2689.description:
Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate an answer
to a question or to solve a problem.

364C3D59910B4DCBBED7C7035E96A5AA.description:
Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in
the point of view they represent.

641E2080774E4091BBFCF22E97580DB5.description:
Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect,
problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.

3D67BB5BF15C48019109B48C2C149EB6.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant
to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

FA7851A187C64E08A1A536264BDD85C8.description:
Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in
a historical, scientific and/or technical text based on specific information in the text(s).

B8B722DF63D1462E8ABF185690817017.description:
Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details;
summarize the text.

216902F3DF0144E0BE919D512B225AFB.description:
Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing
inferences.

CE7DB5CB19674E72A08C02169653444B.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the
high end of the grades 4–5 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

CDF269D51EFC433BAD4077E67624885B.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7AB8DED9231D47AC9A3B062B0FEC1F48.description:
Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their
approaches to similar themes and topics.

C0BA33082999443CB91A38A69FB136AF.description:
Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or mood of a text (e.g.,
graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

97F4FAA0FF454A138594580DF8A25235.description:
Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view and/or perspective influences how events are
described.

2D669987044D433C9A9A845E0422F130.description:
Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fit together to provide the overall structure of a
particular story, drama, or poem.

CB68F46AB066441F9D2EE7B806CB7CBF.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language
such as metaphors and similes.

318C36AB58F34AA1B11A6B5EF82EE0E9.description:
Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on
specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

CADC4D9DEC7945C78464CF13B3D43F65.description:
Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a
story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize
the text.

676B063B8AD34D1589B9FC7D5E4EF2BF.description:
Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing
inferences.
